Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
Funding_Details:
Each of the 60 scholarships awarded annually provides:
*   A €10,000 stipend for one year of full-time study, intended to cover living expenses and student costs.
*   A full fee waiver of all tuition and other registration costs at the chosen Irish higher education institution.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to outstanding non-EU/EEA students (excluding Russian and Belarusian nationals). Applicants must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution at NFQ levels 9 or 10 (master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programme) at the time of applying. Previous GOI-IES scholarship holders are not eligible. Candidates must be full-time, international, fee-paying students. Applicants should demonstrate academic excellence, leadership potential, a commitment to global engagement, and excellent communication abilities.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programmes (NFQ levels 9 or 10) in a wide range of disciplines. No general field restrictions, but applicants are advised to check with their chosen eligible higher education institutions if specific courses they offer accept GOI-IES scholars.
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Relevant Master's degree
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must secure a conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish HEI before applying for the scholarship. Applicants must be prepared to cover any additional costs not covered by the scholarship. Applicants must be full-time, international, fee-paying students.
Career_Plan: Applicants are expected to articulate their long-term goals and aspirations, typically through their personal statement and essay questions, demonstrating how the scholarship will benefit their future and contribute to their home country.
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters: Required. Guidance for Referees is available on the official GOI-IES webpage. Applicants must ensure they have sufficient additional funding or personal savings to cover other costs while studying in Ireland, beyond the scholarship's provisions.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious and highly competitive flagship funding initiative designed to attract top-tier international students to Ireland. Funded by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA), the scholarship supports outstanding non-EU/EEA students pursuing master's, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programmes at NFQ levels 9 or 10. It aims to enhance Ireland's international reputation as a centre for high-quality education and research by attracting top-level international students.
Application_Documents:
Personal statement
Responses to essay questions
Academic transcripts
Recommendation letters
Proof of admission offer from an eligible Irish HEI
Other documents as specified in the GOI-IES Call Document and Application Help Document.
Key documents include the GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document, and an indicative application form to assist candidates in preparation.
Timeline:
Applicants must first apply to their chosen Irish higher education institution and secure a conditional or final offer of admission.
Late 2024/early 2025 : Call for applications for the 2025/2026 academic year opened.
Once an offer is secured, applicants register on the Government of Ireland scholarship portal to access and complete the official GOI-IES application form.
All required documents, including academic transcripts, recommendation letters, and personal statements, must be prepared and submitted according to the instructions.
March 5, 2025 : Application deadline for the 2025/2026 academic year.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Scholars receive a monthly allowance ranging from €900 to €1000. For some programs, the total grant can amount to up to €9,000, disbursed in installments.
Tuition Fee Waiver: Recipients benefit from a full exemption from university tuition fees, with the exception of regional tax and tax stamp, which may still apply.
Health and Medical Insurance: Grantees are provided with comprehensive health and medical/accident insurance, contracted by MAECI, for the entire duration of their scholarship.
Quantity: Not explicitly specified, competitive selection process.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to international applicants who are not residing in Italy at the time of application, and Italian nationals living abroad (IRE). Applicants must meet academic, age, and language proficiency criteria as defined in the official call for applications.
Eligible_Fields:
Degrees: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD
Higher Education: Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs
Research: Under academic supervision
Language and Culture: Advanced Italian language and culture courses
Specific Disciplines: Humanities and Social Sciences, Political Science and International Relations, Health and Medical Sciences
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, Appropriate academic qualification
Language_Certificate: CEFR B2 (for Italian or English-taught programs), CEFR A2 (for advanced Italian language and culture courses)
Age: 18-28 years old by application deadline (for Master’s Degree, AFAM Programs, and Italian Language and Culture Advanced Courses); Under 30 years old by application deadline (for PhD Programs).
Special_Circumstances: Renewable for subsequent academic years for students enrolled in multi-year courses, provided specific performance requirements are met.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must not be residing in Italy at the time of application (for international students). The scholarship is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, officially known as the MAECI Scholarship, is a prestigious program provided by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). It supports international students not residing in Italy, as well as Italian nationals living abroad (IRE), in pursuing higher education and research opportunities in Italy. The scholarship aims to strengthen international cultural and scientific cooperation, promote the Italian language and higher education system worldwide, and support Italy’s economic system.
Application_Documents:
Curriculum Vitae (CV)
Personal Statement (Motivation Letter, max 1000 words)
Academic Transcripts
Current Passport
Evidence of Language Competency (Italian or English)
Admission Letter from the Italian University (specifically for PhD programs)
Score Statement (e.g., for previous degrees)
Letters of Recommendation
Timeline:
Applications for the 2025-2026 academic year are open.
2025-05-16 14:00 CET : Application Deadline
2025-11-01 : Start of 9-Month Scholarships
2026-01-01 : Start of 3-Month Scholarships (for advanced Italian language and culture)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Annual Grants:
*   Bachelor's Degree: RMB 20,000
*   Master's Degree: RMB 30,000
*   Doctoral Degree: RMB 40,000
Some sources also indicate a monthly stipend of up to CNY 2,000, which contributes to living expenses.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Study materials
*   Accommodation (e.g., on-campus accommodation, with specific rates like RMB 60/day for single rooms and RMB 50/day for double rooms on certain campuses)
*   Living expenses/Stipend
*   Other study-related expenses
Quantity: Not explicitly specified for overall program; Tianjin University alone nominated 178 applicants in 2020.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to outstanding international students from all countries (excluding citizens of the People’s Republic of China). Applicants must be in good health and meet specific academic, language, and age requirements. A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or equivalent is generally required. Applicants should have a degree in a relevant field for their chosen program. Available for both prospective students (applying for admission) and current students already enrolled at eligible universities in Tianjin. Applicants cannot hold another Chinese government scholarship or a scholarship from the specific Tianjin university simultaneously; deliberate concealment will lead to disqualification. Age limits: Under 30 for Bachelor's, Under 35 for Master's, Under 40 for PhD. Open to both male and female applicants. Renewable annually based on satisfactory academic performance.
Eligible_Fields: Wide range of Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD disciplines available at participating Higher Education Institutions in Tianjin.
Age: Under 30 for Bachelor's, Under 35 for Master's, Under 40 for PhD
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship has a one-year duration but is renewable annually, subject to satisfactory academic performance. It is open to both prospective and current students.
Career_Plan: A personal statement is mandatory, detailing the study/research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths. It should be no less than 800 words for Master's and Doctoral applicants, and no less than 300 words for Bachelor's applicants, written in Chinese or English.
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters are required for Master's, Doctoral, and Senior Scholar programs from different referrers. Original No Crime Certificate. Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy). Passport copy (including visa/residence permit page if the applicant is already studying in China).
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a prestigious program established by the Tianjin Municipal Government to attract outstanding international students to pursue higher education in Tianjin, China. It offers a significant opportunity for students worldwide to gain an internationally respected education in one of China's largest and most rapidly developing cities. It is a key initiative by the Tianjin Municipal Government to enhance its international academic profile and provide a pathway for international students to access quality education in a dynamic Chinese urban environment.
Application_Documents:
Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (to be registered and filled online).
Personal Statement (including study/research plan).
Two Recommendation Letters (for Master's/Doctoral/Senior Scholar programs).
English Proficiency Certificate or HSK-5 certificate (min 180).
Passport copy.
Original No Crime Certificate.
Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy).
Note: Post-admission, documents like the Admission Letter and JW202 form are required for registration.
Timeline:
October 15, 2024 : Application Opening Date (for Tianjin University)
May 20, 2025 : Application Deadline (Nankai University)
May 31, 2025 : Application Deadline (Tianjin University)
June 30, 2025 : Application Deadline (Tianjin Normal University)
Post-deadlines : University Screening (may include video or audio interviews)
Post-screening : Publicization of Results (one week at university level)
Post-publicization : Submission to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission
Post-submission : Final Determination by experts of Tianjin Municipal Education Commission
July 1 to August 31 : Admission Results Announcement and Document Issuance (Admission Notice, JW202)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The scholarship provides a grant of €10,020 per academic year. In addition to this grant, recipients benefit from a full tuition fee waiver, meaning they are only required to pay a minimal administrative enrollment fee to their host institution.
*   Grant of €10,020 per academic year.
*   Full tuition fee waiver (students pay only a minimal administrative enrollment fee).
Quantity: Approximately 30 Master Mind Scholarships are awarded annually to outstanding international students across various universities in Flanders.
Eligible_Applicants: Open to outstanding international students worldwide, with the exception of applicants from Russia. Applicants must apply to and be accepted by a Flemish higher education institution for a master's degree program (60 or 120 ECTS) in Flanders or Brussels. The previous degree (e.g., Bachelor's) used for master's enrollment cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. International students who have previously been on credit mobility (e.g., Erasmus+) in a Flemish institution are still eligible. Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution for a degree program are not eligible to apply.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s Degree (60–120 ECTS) in any eligible program offered by participating Flemish host institutions.
Special_Circumstances: Applicants from Russia are not eligible.
Other_Requirements: The Master Mind Scholarship cannot be combined with another scholarship from the Flemish Government. Not eligible for preparatory programs, bridging programs, or distance learning programs. Specific master's programs at some universities may also be excluded; applicants should verify with their chosen host institution.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship, officially known as the "Master Mind Scholarship (Government of Flanders)", is a prestigious program funded by the Government of Flanders. Its primary objective is to attract outstanding international students from around the world to pursue master's degree programs in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium, fostering academic excellence and internationalization within Flemish higher education institutions.
Application_Documents:
For Host Institution Application (Initial Stage):
*   Complete application file for an eligible master’s program.
*   KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying to KU Leuven).

For Master Mind Scholarship Application (After Nomination):
*   Mandatory Master Mind Scholarship Application Form.
*   Official letter of acceptance from the host university.
*   Letter of exemption (provided by the host university).
*   Letter of motivation written in English.
*   Two signed letters of recommendation from professors.
*   Academic transcripts and degree certificates.
*   Proof of English language proficiency.
*   Copy of passport.
Timeline:
Preceding academic year : Applications open
January 15 : Host Institution Application Deadline
After January 15 : Host Institution Nomination
March 15 : Master Mind Application Form Deadline
Mid-April : Shortlisted students contacted to complete online application
End of April : Final Decision by Flemish Government

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded scholarship program.
*   Full tuition coverage for programs listed in the official academic offer.
*   Monthly stipends, equivalent to three (3) times the Colombian minimum wage, paid quarterly.
*   Health/Medical Insurance.
*   Installation expenses.
*   Expenses for books and materials.
*   Immigration support.
Eligible_Applicants: Must be a foreign citizen from any nationality. Must not possess Colombian nationality or dual nationality (Colombian). Must not be residing, nor have resided in Colombian territory for the last six (6) months prior to applying for the scholarship, or have started studies in Colombia at the time of application. Must not have been a beneficiary of ICETEX through the Beca Colombia program in previous calls. Applicants from non-Spanish-speaking countries are also eligible, provided they meet the Spanish language proficiency requirements.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s, Ph.D., and Specialization degree programs across various disciplines. Must be listed in the 2025-2 ACADEMIC OFFER CATALOG.
Special_Circumstances: Country reciprocity (if the applicant's country provides scholarships to Colombians) may influence the selection process, accounting for 10% of the evaluation criteria.
Career_Plan: Scholarship recipients are expected to return to their country of origin or residence after completing their studies to apply the acquired knowledge.
Other_Requirements: Must be admitted to at least one (and up to three) eligible postgraduate programs at a Colombian higher education institution. A Letter of Academic Recommendation, issued by an academic at the university where undergraduate studies were completed, is required. Scholarship recipients agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends. Scholarships are awarded on an annual term; for academic programs longer than 12 months (Master's and Doctorate), scholars must request an extension for the subsequent year.
Scholarship_Info: The Beca Colombia Scholarship Program for Foreigners is a fully funded initiative by the Colombian Government, administered by ICETEX, offering international students the opportunity to pursue graduate studies (Specialization, Master's, and Doctorate degrees) in accredited Colombian higher education institutions to foster academic, cultural, and technological exchange.
Application_Documents:
*   Verified copies of Educational Transcripts.
*   Experience report signed by the tutor or director of the academic program (if applicable).
*   Certificate from the University stating current enrollment and program duration (if applicable).
*   Letter of Academic Recommendation.
*   Spanish language proficiency test certificate (DELE or SIELE) with a minimum B2 level.
Timeline:
2025-05-28 : Application Opening Date
2025-06-13 : Application Deadline
2025-06-13 – 2025-06-20 : Evaluation and Selection Period
